ASSISTANT PROJECT MANAGER
Professional Summary
Confident Assistant Project Manager with demonstrated skills in many applicable construction management fields and stakeholder communication.
Highly effective at tackling multiple tasks at once and working with lots of different personalities.
Seeking similar position with driven, competitive and established company.

SKILLS

Scheduling of meetings Client interfacing Commercial construction Residential construction Effective communication Construction management Team oversight Budgeting
Project estimation and bidding Blueprints and schematics Good multitasker Strong team player Knowledgeable in Excel, Word, Power Point, CMiC, ProCore, Bluebeam, P6 Navigate through Revit, Autocad, Navisworks Cost control Schedule management
Work History
Assistant Project Manager ,

07/2017 to Current
Company Name
— City , State
Mentored and guided associates in approaches designed to exceed expectations of customers and members Adapted quickly to changing and competing project demands Adjusted project plans to account for dynamic targets, staffing changes and operational specifications Supported senior managers and department leaders by completing projects and problem resolution under tight budgets and schedule demands Managed cost projections, prepared budgets and cost reports Delivered high level of service to clients to both maintain and extend relationship for future business opportunities Closely collaborated with project members to identify and quickly address problems Review and assist in accurate exposure projections and actively work to reduce / eliminate these exposures Managed upwards of 20 trades at different times during current project Managed and completed cost reporting, additional sub management, PE management, monthly progress package, schedule updates, etc. during transition periods of two separate project managers leaving current project
Senior Project Engineer ,

11/2015 to 07/2017
Company Name
— City , State
Reviewed contractor proposals and sets of drawings prepared by A and E firms to identify missing information, generate questions and align budgets Oversaw worksite construction to coordinate with supervisors and guide projects Managed projects effectively to deliver finished work on time Assisted in estimating, cost analysis, value engineering, material sourcing, etc. to assist Ownership in meeting budgets while still maintaining A&E's design intent Helped with coordination of Owner expectation vs.
GMP for finish scope to assist Ownership in releasing interiors package for the project Went to weekly offsite meetings at Ownership's office to work with Owners, A&E, Developers, Marketing team, etc. to assist in finalization of design to match budget
Project Engineer ,

02/2014 to 11/2015
Company Name
— City , State
Evaluated change order requests in response to out-of-scope work activities and developing field conditions Performed constructibility reviews consisting of independent, structured assessment of construction bid documents to ensure coordination, eliminate ambiguity and minimize project issues Monitored installation of materials and equipment for compliance with drawings and specifications Generated change orders for project using estimating CMiC & Bluebeam Completed sub prequalification, bid review, post bid interviews, document review to complete accurate and detailed project buyout and GMP Wrote RFIs, compiled submittals, posted to record set, permitted documents, submitted for deferred design, etc Assisted in project closeout and final change orders for all managed trades

EDUCATION

Associate of Science :
Construction Management ,

California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo
— City , State

CERTIFICATIONS

OSHA 30 Certified, First Aid Certified, NAHB Green Building Certified

<JD_START>
Job Title: Project Manager - WWTP - URGENTLT HIRING

Location: West Virginia, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Overview

Our client, an industry-leading construction company, is seeking an experienced Project Manager for Water and Wastewater Treatment Plant projects. As a 100% employee-owned company, our client offers a dynamic and results-oriented atmosphere where employees share in the company's success and profits.

Duties And Responsibilities

Oversee project development, ensuring timely delivery within scope and budget.Supervise project buyout in collaboration with the estimator.Manage submittals and the RFI process.Lead planning and progress meetings, creating agendas and executing cost-to-complete reports.Review subcontractor and vendor payments and analyze subcontractor billings.Maintain necessary logs including change orders, field orders, submittals, RFIs, and more.Track materials used on the job site.Collaborate with the Vice President of Project Management to effectively manage projects.Coordinate payments with lower-tier vendors and subcontractors.Mentor and train Assistant Project Managers and Project Engineers.Participate in professional trade groups.

Qualifications/Experience

Bachelor's degree in civil engineering, construction management, or related field.Professional Certification.Registered Professional Engineer (preferred).5-10 years of experience as an Assistant Project Manager or Project Engineer.5+ years in heavy civil construction with Water/Wastewater Treatment Plant experience.

Competencies

Knowledge of Water/Wastewater Treatment Plant construction and systems.Ability to manage medium-sized projects.Strong negotiation skills.Understanding of project financial reporting and minority goals.Familiarity with contract documents and dispute resolution procedures.Leadership and management skills.Proficient written and verbal communication skills.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, P6, and Viewpoint software.Proactive, self-motivated, problem solver.

Position Type/Expected Hours Of Work

This is a full-time position, typically 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday. Flexibility is required to support time-sensitive issues as they arise, with an emphasis on meeting assigned responsibilities.

Work Environment

Work is primarily performed in a non-smoking office environment, with fieldwork and travel required. Overnight stays may be necessary depending on project demands.

Physical Requirements

Employees must be able to:

Sit (or stand) for prolonged periods.Occasionally lift up to 50 pounds.Occasionally bend, twist, squat, kneel, and walk up/down stairs.Demonstrate visual and hearing acuity.Work on outdoor construction sites with uneven terrain and in various weather conditions.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits

401(k) with matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insurance

Education: Bachelor's degree (Preffered)

Relocation assitance

To Apply, Please Include

Resume and project history

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award-winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States since 1990. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
